channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The U.S. hasn’t sanctioned Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich because Ukraine’s President Zelensky said he's acting as a go-between in peace talks with Russia, people familiar with the plans said https://t.co/FBpRiVMm4p

Nestlé is to scale back what it sells in Russia, suspending production of pet food, coffee and confectionery, a move that comes after the company has faced pressure from politicians, employees and consumers for its continuing presence in the country https://t.co/V6UGzntg9Z
The Biden administration is preparing sanctions on most members of Russia’s State Duma, the lower house of parliament, as the U.S. continues its crackdown on Moscow https://t.co/QbWB3RcGMI

Watch: This Wall Street Journal documentary follows the monthslong, 14,000-mile journey of a typical consumer good from factory to front door to reveal the vulnerabilities of the global supply chain. https://t.co/YtEfSuAqQV

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine spurred the biggest price shock in decades, hitting developing countries particularly hard.
“If this conflict continues, the impact will probably be more consequential than the coronavirus crisis,” said a World Bank official. https://t.co/PzQ5npWzm9
Ukraine is using Soviet-era air-defense batteries and modern, shoulder-launched missiles supplied by the West to inflict heavy losses on Russian combat planes and helicopters https://t.co/nVUggvi2UP
From @WSJopinion: Neither the Saudis nor the Emiratis will take Biden’s calls. The U.S. needs to recommit to the region, writes @FirasMaksad https://t.co/wzgn5QDvUF
Companies owned by Russian oligarchs say they're struggling to make payments to foreign creditors. The first major default could come as soon as Wednesday. https://t.co/c0bBHTcFg3

The battle for the southern port city of Mariupol intensified Tuesday with fleeing civilians describing Russian and Ukrainian forces locked in street-by-street warfare as Moscow’s airstrikes gutted entire neighborhoods https://t.co/kuRFxWD6lo

MacKenzie Scott, one of the richest women in the world, has donated $436 million to Habitat for Humanity, the organization said Tuesday, in one of the billionaire philanthropist’s largest publicly disclosed donations https://t.co/l3rVVLHqV6
The U.S. and U.K. struck a deal to remove U.S. tariffs on British steel and aluminum. The U.K. will lift levies on American whiskey, motorcycles and tobacco. https://t.co/ogKoNMGgIQ

The U.S. and U.K. struck a trade accord Tuesday that will remove U.S. tariffs on British steel and aluminum, while the U.K. will lift levies on American whiskey, motorcycles and tobacco https://t.co/OGlik8yWak

From @WSJopinion: To cut off Putin’s oil and gas sales globally, the administration and Congress should impose secondary sanctions on the entirety of Russia’s financial sector, writes @SenToomey https://t.co/cewIE5wSsF

Sen. Cory Booker delivered the day’s most impassioned Democratic rebuttal to Republican senators’ arguments that Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's record shows her to be soft on crime: “I sat here and was a little insulted about the accusation." https://t.co/1GPo3yYHaD
Two private islands that were owned by the late disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein are going on the market for $125 million https://t.co/yaXnBgQOS0

Nearly a month after Russia invaded Ukraine, it is on the verge of taking Mariupol in what would be the first major city to fall under its control. But Mariupol is a shattered prize. https://t.co/fvklm28H1N
The U.S. is preparing new sanctions on more than 300 members of Russia’s lower chamber of parliament, officials say https://t.co/Gdk75gK6ie

MacKenzie Scott, one of the richest women in the world, has donated $436 million to Habitat for Humanity, the organization said Tuesday, in one of the billionaire philanthropist’s largest publicly disclosed donations https://t.co/ekNICLfp9V
President Biden plans to join with allies in announcing further sanctions on Russia at a meeting in Brussels on Thursday, national security adviser Jake Sullivan said https://t.co/Ok1luMWaA9

Russia’s leading opposition figure, Alexei Navalny, was sentenced to nine more years in prison on charges of fraud and contempt of court, in a case his supporters say was brought against him on the orders of President Vladimir Putin https://t.co/dIlYVjDs4e

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine spurred the biggest price shock in decades, hitting developing countries particularly hard.
“If this conflict continues, the impact will probably be more consequential than the coronavirus crisis,” said a World Bank official. https://t.co/MKDHwWo4lT
Ukraine is using Soviet-era air-defense batteries and modern, shoulder-launched missiles supplied by the West to inflict heavy losses on Russian combat planes and helicopters https://t.co/3hl48HZIFx

Disney CEO Bob Chapek told employees Monday that the company made a mistake by not taking a public stance against Florida’s recently passed Parental Rights in Education bill, a decision which infuriated many at the entertainment giant https://t.co/9kizR438w3
Elon Musk formally kicked off customer deliveries at Tesla's first European factory outside Berlin, marking a milestone in the electric-car maker’s international expansion https://t.co/e8fhsAdN8q

Elon Musk handed the first few Tesla Model Y vehicles to customers at the opening of Giga Berlin-Brandenburg, the electric-car company’s first European factory #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/vv5sl4PVtJ https://t.co/AE8yiQCBmE

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine spurred the biggest price shock in decades, hitting developing countries particularly hard. “If this conflict continues, the impact will probably be more consequential than the coronavirus crisis.” https://t.co/cfqrzxCKxM
“It’s a huge unaccounted-for risk,” said a former FBI adviser, of potential cyberattacks by Russia on banks’ AI systems https://t.co/4FAJhmdtpY
The Biden administration has concluded that the Myanmar military’s violence against the Rohingya minority amounts to genocide https://t.co/c81SsuactF

Russia's leading opposition figure, Alexei Navalny, was sentenced to nine more years in prison on charges of fraud and contempt of court. His supporters say President Vladimir Putin ordered the case to silence him. https://t.co/j6U7YDt0TH
Russian airstrikes, artillery and mortar rounds have gutted entire neighborhoods in Mariupol. https://t.co/ZSEuvEE30I
Okta said it is investigating reports of a digital breach after hackers posted images they said were of the company’s internal systems https://t.co/RtA1djjSw4

The Russian winner of the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize said he wants to auction the medal to aid Ukrainian refugees. Dmitry Muratov, editor-in-chief of the Russian Novaya Gazeta newspaper, won the prize for his "efforts to safeguard freedom of expression." https://t.co/fcsIk9Nznp

From @WSJopinion: Biden’s NATO objective must be broader. If Russian troops withdraw from Ukraine but Putin is still in charge in Moscow, it will be a severe defeat for America, writes @BingWest https://t.co/9DnUSa4xbU
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/Ru4CK91dJG
A Ukrainian pop star escaped war in her home country to sing at South by Southwest, and to be a voice for those—including her bandmates—who stayed behind to fight https://t.co/Yq0EJuaefd
Rescuers haven’t found any survivors at the site in southern China where a China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737 crashed https://t.co/bsXGfrGMJF
Out of the NFL for five years, Colin Kaepernick has launched a renewed campaign to get signed. Does he have a chance? https://t.co/yURdkN8YUC
The U.S. secretly acquired Soviet air-defense weapons as part of a Pentagon intelligence program. Now it's sending them to Ukraine. https://t.co/co3yic3CjK
For years, many ranchers have blamed meatpacking giants for low cattle prices. Now, some cattlemen say they have a solution: Process the beef themselves. https://t.co/8U1YFMDg4L

From @WSJopinion: Team Biden doesn’t want to give the Ukrainians fighter jets, but why not send them as spare parts, asks @katebachwsj. Here’s a compromise that would salvage American credibility and show some ingenuity. https://t.co/2gILYF9St0
An FAA training specialist testified that a former Boeing pilot lied to her about how a 737 MAX flight-control system worked before two of the jets crashed https://t.co/HzzsREMKEW

From @WSJopinion: Healthy children don’t need Covid vaccines, writes @AllysiaFinley. Florida is right. Especially for kids under 12, the risks are trivial. And most have natural antibodies. https://t.co/E6hM0JOcyE

A new study found that people who recovered from Covid-19 within the past year were 40% more likely to receive a new diagnosis of diabetes compared to those who weren’t infected https://t.co/Qs7ozrz69A
The U.S. secretly acquired Soviet air-defense weapons as part of a Pentagon intelligence program. Now it's sending them to Ukraine. https://t.co/YSeMzXAfcr

Daddy Yankee, the reggaeton musician known for hits including “Gasolina” and “Despacito,” said that he plans to retire from music after a career that spanned more than three decades https://t.co/5d23zKs2o4

At her Supreme Court confirmation hearing, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson said she hopes to carry on the spirit of Justice Stephen Breyer, for whom she had clerked and is now hoping to succeed https://t.co/LjgCBniRsQ

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank is prepared to raise interest rates in half-percentage-point steps and high enough to deliberately slow the economy if it concludes such steps are warranted to bring inflation down https://t.co/JYwcqBNN10

Sen. Cory Booker (D., N.J.), one of just three Black senators, said he was joyous over Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's historic nomination. "This is not a normal day for America, we have never had this day before," Mr. he said. https://t.co/TDHfQ7vFIb

The superyachts of Russia’s super rich have taken on outsize symbolism as targets of Ukraine-related sanctions. But while some luxury vessels have been seized at Europe’s ports, others made it to open water. https://t.co/mDFfOq0WDi
Support for an EU-wide ban on Russian oil is growing, diplomats say. It marks a major shift in Europe's stance on ratcheting up pressure on Moscow. https://t.co/kmvKljx7uk
